website_summaries.verdict: A comb designed to take care of really difficult tangles without pulling your pet's hair too much.
pros: Two sides to the brush allows you to use as needed for either matting or shedding on different parts of your pet
Works well on pets who have not been combed for a while
Can sometimes get the mats out better than scissors
Helps speed up the summer shedding – even on dogs with a lot of hair
Rounded teeth ends won't hurt your dog's skin
cons: Some very thick haired dogs may find this brush pulls their hair a little too much for comfort

customer_reviews.title: This tool worked as advertised and myself and my cat Fatty are very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to the pet grooming game and I recently rescued a Persian cat of which needs constant grooming. He came with some matting and I tried scissors and even pet hair clippers but was afraid I'd cut his skin. This tool worked as advertised and myself and my cat Fatty are very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: MANIA

customer_reviews.title: Miracle worker!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Newfoundlands and the summer shed had just begun. They shed faster than my daily vacuuming can keep up with, but the summer shed made it infinitely worse. I wish this brush were wider with more teeth to the comb, but it is still a great product. In about an hour I had pulled off a pile of hair as big as my 150lb puppy. He is happier and cooler, and I am happy that all that fur is not on my floors, clothes, furniture, and walls!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this. As for mats, it took a lot to even get a little one out. It was easier to just give my dog a big hair cut because it was making her uncomfortable. As for brushing however, it did a great job! It gets a lot of the undercoat out and my dog loved every second of it. Every time I would stop for just a few seconds she would just look at me and wait for me to keep brushing her and as soon as I would start again she would almost snore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a must for long hair cats with tangles!!
customer_reviews.text: This works!!! We have a long hair black cat who's hair tangles and knots up. He also has horrible anxiety problems! So taking him to a groomer was out of the question. I was able to comb all through his hair. He purred and rolled over. I think he is incredibly grateful to have the knots gone. I imagine they hurt and pull at his skin. Update!!! Is it possible for something to be too good?!! Our cat still loves it!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: If your dog has a fluffy coat, you should NOT pass this up!
customer_reviews.text: A police officer actually introduced me to this amazing tool. My Irish Wolfhound LOVES it and oh my gosh with the summer coming, the winter coat is going. The picture shown is one of many clumps of undercoat was removed from a dog that gets combed two to three times a day. That pile is only TWO strokes! Quality product with high end materials. Four Stars
customer_reviews.author: Rev Mike Lawlor

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to give this waste of money minus stars. One by one, the teeth on this crappy comb have snapped off! Awful quality. The seller should be ashamed.
customer_reviews.author: Lianimals

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: My very grumpy cat had some matting in the rear and the average comb or brush was not doing the job. This (and a pair of pet sheers) got all the matts out. I only needed the sheers to snip off the ends if the knots and this brush did the rest. Be careful it can snag tho. Now that all the knits are out i continue to use this brush to keep it from mattimg again and it works great. There are 2 sides. The side to get the knots out and the side to keep up on thinning out the gross fur and dander
customer_reviews.author: Teddi Redbones

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL 😩
customer_reviews.text: Mid evil torture device!!!! We ALL, including the pups, HATED it!!!!!! PLUS, it didn't even work... Just tortured my pups, and got stuck in their coat!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C.

customer_reviews.title: If I could give higher rating I would! Really ...
customer_reviews.text: If I could give higher rating I would! Really made my day grooming a guard Pyrenees so much easier as she has never been groomed before. WILL BE GETTING ANOTHER AND TELLING EVERYONE ABOUT IT! 😍🤗
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K. Pick

customer_reviews.title: Pulls fur
customer_reviews.text: Pulls my dogs fur too much she tries to nip me when brushing her and she runs away. Never seen her act this way about a brush before. Don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: NOT for thick coated dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a de-shedder for my German Shepherd Chow mix. Unfortunately, this is not a good de-shedder for thick coated dogs with lots of undercoat. It pulled the hair as badly as the furminator and was not a pleasant experience for the dog - I will be returning it. The video shows the slicker brush compared to using the grooming tool. I brush the dog every two days - there are no mats.
customer_reviews.author: SweetPea

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend for cats
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, out of all the brushes I have ever tried on my cat, she hates this one with a passion. She typically loves being brushed, but will go as far as to swipe and bite at this brush which she has never done before (even when it is on on the bed in front of her, not being held). The only reason I can think of for why she would act this way towards this brush is that is is somehow too rough or painful for her. She does not reach this way to the Furminator, a variety of different slicker brushes, or a soft bristle type brush.
customer_reviews.author: b.rix

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy or you’ll be returning it like me
customer_reviews.text: Does nothing that a wide tooth grooming comb couldn’t do. Complete waste of money! My dog winced in pain when using it. How is this helping make it easier to get rid of matting in fur? Wish I would have read the negative reviews first. Sending back for refund. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: C. Buck

customer_reviews.title: But this is better than anything else I have tried
customer_reviews.text: Dematting is a work in progress with my long-haired cat. I kind of wish the cutting option was available on both sides. But this is better than anything else I have tried. Eventually, the cat will be dematted and I will keep up with it. The good thing -- which has nothing to do with the product -- is that my cat hasn't ever had any hairballs. A miracle itself.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya A.

customer_reviews.title: This tool is too agressive. It’s takes all the hair out.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Maine coon. He’s very furry and gets some mats. I was looking for a brush that would gently remove the mats. This brush gets the mats out. But if I keep using it my cat will be bald!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and very effective
customer_reviews.text: For our Great Pyrenees this tool is a terrific time-saver. It also worked well for the Himalayan cat which is a long hair breed. Probably we will buy another one before next year rolls around just because we have so much hair to control here. We continue to use this item and it continues to do a very good job. The dog is happy to let us work on her as much as necessary. Therefore, we believe that it must be comfortable for her.
customer_reviews.author: Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Best for thick undercoats
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best tool I've ever purchased. It actually gets to my cat's thick undercoat. I have the biggest Furminator but it doesn't begin to touch the fine undercoat fur. Thanks for making such a great product! I'm very pleased and so is Rudy!
customer_reviews.author: Acarberger

customer_reviews.title: We recently welcomed a German Shepherd into our home and ...
customer_reviews.text: We recently welcomed a German Shepherd into our home and, even with daily brushing with a regular dog brush, fur was flying all day, every day. This rake came today and the amount of hair pulled out in the five minutes I was able to use it before rain came, it was astounding. It was a pile about half the size of our big dog. (I would not do this inside unless absolutely necessary, it pulls off SO much hair.) So with five minutes of use, I give this an enthusiastic 5 star rating and I cannot wait to get back out there and finish brushing our girl!
customer_reviews.author: Meeshi

customer_reviews.title: Pulls dogs hair OUT
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews before I bought thinking this was going to be a great brush for my Pyrenees dogs. The blades on the comb are not sharp enough to cut through the thick hair and end up pulling out the dogs hair. I couldn’t even get it to go through their hair! They are not matted but if you do not brush their hair with a different brush BEFORE you even use this, it will PULL your dogs hair not comb. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mindi mcnair

customer_reviews.title: I love the product BUT MORE IMPORTANTLY
customer_reviews.text: I love the product BUT MORE IMPORTANTLY, my 10 year old kitty loves it! I have always combed her long, thick coat, but now she will come lay at my feet, lay on her side and meows at me until I give her a few strokes.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine G.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for cocker spaniel matting/ worked for shedding pyrenees
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help with the matting under my long haired curly cocker spaniel's coat. Specifically under his legs in the pit areas. Ouch! He hated it. It took a lot of force to get through one area and I didn't have the heart to continue. However, when I used it on my great pyrenees with a long straight very thick coat it went through like butter. He's losing his under coat currently. it took it right off. The bag of his legs have some matting and again this did nothing but pull and hurt him as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Have a large long haired cat that hates to be brushed. So every so often he develops a matted area on his back. Product worked well in removing matted area. Now if someone can develop a way to keep him still.....
customer_reviews.author: SANDRA

customer_reviews.title: painful
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this brush on my german shepherd as he sheds all the time. I have used the mars coat king brush in the past but decided to give this one a try because of the $15 savings. I wish i hadn't tried something new. I guess you get what you pay for. This brush did not glide through my dogs hair but instead it pulled it very painfully. My dog does not have matted or tangled hair as he is brushed twice a week using the mars coat king brush. I am returning this brush and I'm going to purchase another mars coat king instead. do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS

customer_reviews.title: $15 Hair ripper
customer_reviews.text: I envisioned this slicing through matted hair. It does no such thing. If your pet will tolerate you grabbing a fist full of hair and ripping it straight out of the animal, then this is for you. It's waaaay to dull to cut through mats and impossible to drag through the fur. Yep, total waste of money. Pet is a one year old Golden Doodle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pulls hair not brushes
customer_reviews.text: My dog is an Aussue and she just cries and whimpers, all this brush does is pull her hair. The teeth are too large and just grab hair, not pull through it
customer_reviews.author: K.Kronenberg

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get out the mats
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work as id wished. I have two long haired cats that get mats very easily and bought this brush to get rid of the mats. This did remove a lot of hair but because the brush does not hold onto the hair, it went flying all over my living room. It got caught on the mats and did a lot of tugging and pulling resulting in my cats biting at the brush. I followed the directions on the package it just did not work on the mats no matter which side I used. I got a full refund though.
customer_reviews.author: Renee wise

customer_reviews.title: My Sadie loves this and it WORKS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My rescue dog with terribly matted fur actually tolerated this one. We started with the wide side, then moved to the narrow side after removing much if the matting. Over a number of days after the matting was gone, she came to love the "back scratching" effect this provides. I had read other reviews that also said their dog loved it. I didn't think mine would because she had been so traumatized earlier in her life and at the animal shelter. She was terrified of everything and everyone. This comb WORKS without pulling or hurting. If my dog loves it, yours will too. Don't be afraid to buy this. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Southwind

customer_reviews.title: Remove Mats Now!
customer_reviews.text: Well, my cat is not as happy about this as I am, but it does work. This tool takes some practice to use effectively so don't give up, pets don't like changes (especially cats) and using this tool on them is a change. It will work through mats, but be careful when the mats have worked down to their skin and do watch online videos showing proper use. There are two sides to the comb, one to loosen up/remove the mat and one to keep mats at bay - at least that's how it's working for me. It is a good tool and once I am better at using it the comb will be great for removing kitty's mats.
customer_reviews.author: jotitdown

customer_reviews.title: Furminator fan here! But, this is definitely a must have tool!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll admit, I am a furminator fan 110%. But, one of my German Shepherd has quite a bit of longer hair than the rest of my pack. He’s still considered short coat. For whatever reason he hates the furminator and I couldn’t manage to get all the undercoat out no matter how often I was brushing. I figured Ill set myself up for disappointment and try this brush. Boy was I wrong!! I will never go without keeping one of these in my grooming equipment ever again. The picture is 5 minutes of brush and he isn’t blowing coat. This brush will undoubtedly help with keeping shedding to a minimum for all those 2 coated dogs known as shedders!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Richards

customer_reviews.title: REALLY WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several brushes and combs that were guaranteed to remove lots of hair from my long-haired cats, but this one actually does it! I am beyond pleased as some of the others worked a little, but my cats didn't like the way they felt when being brushed, so would run from it. They love this thing and gave me no trouble with multiple brushings. Some hair floated off a bit, but most was caught in the teeth and easily removed. SO much hair came out, so I know with regular brushing they will have far fewer hairball issues. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marian B.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Old English Sheep Dog
customer_reviews.text: Omg! It works! Took the knots out like nobody’s business! And it wasn’t painful for him. He laid down and just let me comb it through! Man, wish I found this sooner. Telling everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Stephie

customer_reviews.title: Works well, dog seems to enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: These long-haired hippie dogs are squatting in my house. To make them less tie-dye and sandals wearing and more good household citizens, I've been trying to brush them a couple times a week. With just a brush they glare at me and say "Dude!" a lot, mostly because they long-haired hippies managed to tangle up their manes in knots every few seconds. With this, they do sit quietly and endure the indignity and actually seem to enjoy it. The teeth are deep enough for the longer haired dog. There is some resistance as the wispier hairs are culled, but after a few strokes the rake pulls through cleanly. Some mats were beyond this rake, but most others were resolved quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kwan L. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for White German Shepherd fur! It gets deep down to the undercoat but doesn't scratch the skin. My shepherd's fur takes several types of brushes (Shedding Blade, Pin Brush, Furminator) and this one is a perfect addition. It's unbelievable how much fur comes off. Be gentle; if your dog has tangles or matted fur you should brush slowly at first until no tangles are left. Then you can work on getting the undercoat brushed out. Also ensure the coat/fur is dry or it pulls to hard.
customer_reviews.author: B in OR

customer_reviews.title: My dog has never felt so good!
customer_reviews.text: My shorter hair German shepherd has always hated when we tried to brush her with a bristle style brush. She was scared for about the first minute and then she just started loving it like we were scratching / rubbing her. This brush removes so much hair so quickly and doesn’t snag at all (unless you push really hard or maybe if your dogs hair was really tangled). My wife and I love this and will probably get a second one for a relative. (Maybe there will be less hair floating through the house now!!!)
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product a 10 out of a 10, I would. I have an all-white Siberian Husky, so you know the shedding is constant and a lot. With this grooming tool, after I brush her, I don't have to worry about chunks of hair floating on my floor moments later. This tool helps with the shedding. Thank you so much! Also, I made add that this brush does not hurt my dog like other brushes; her skin is not left red after brushing due to the teeth never touch her skin. Happy Husky and Happy Husky Mom!
customer_reviews.author: Paula L Raphael

customer_reviews.title: Take your pet to the groomer instead
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money, the blade part of this comb is 100% dull. All it did was pull the fur and piss off the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha S.

customer_reviews.title: Wow! I pulled a dog off of my dog.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it when I pull out this grooming tool. She sheds a full vacuum cleaner container every day. The first time I pulled this groomer down her pelt, it came up with a giant ball of fur. Every time I brush her, I get a pile almost as big as her. Her coat is so much softer and shinier now as well. Love it. The two sides are perfect, one aggressive one to de-tangle mats and a finer side for combing out to a smooth finish.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A.

customer_reviews.title: Very gentle on the animal!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had golden retrievers for more than 40 years. Currently we are on No. 5 ( a very thick-headed and thick-coated male, our first male). Over the years we have tried many different types of brushes and combs but none of them have worked as well as this does. It has the ability to get down deep in his fir without "pulling." I think it actually cuts through the tangles which makes it the most gentle pet grooming tool I have ever used. I regret I was not aware of this type of grooming tool for our goldens 1-4.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Glaser

customer_reviews.title: works beautifully for long haired dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 purebred labs. One has short hair and one has a thick long coat. This doesn't work for the short hair one, but works beautifully for the long hair one. It pulls off so much hair. I do use this in combo with the Furminator undercoat to get off the most amount of hair. I will say I take my dogs hiking in the woods and they often times get into bushes with burrs on them. I have always had to pick them off one at time, but I tried this brush on it for the first time, and it pulled so many off at the same time, and that was on both dogs. I am super impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Kate R

customer_reviews.title: This One Works
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several brushes for my Bloodhound who sheds constantly... this one works and she loves it. It doesn't poke her and she stays still while brushing, so I guess she likes it. I checked the reviews carefully before ordering it and I saw the pictures of piles of hair and thought, really? Let me tell you...REALLY! I was shocked how much under coat we were able to get off her.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Tiki

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For Fur
customer_reviews.text: This tool is amazing! My long-haired cat is getting older and not grooming herself as good as she used to so she is getting tons of knots and matted areas. I brush her weekly, but her brushes cannot get through her tangled spots without hurting and irritating her. This grooming tool removes dead fur that the regular brushes didn’t touch. I am getting enough fur off my cat to make a whole other cat! The only trick is to loosen up the knots before brushing through them slowly and as gently as possible. She is getting used to this new grooming tool and actually guiding me to spots she wants brushed.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Just rips out mats, dog yelping in pain
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because reviews were great. I have a poodle spaniel mix who had a small amount of matting in 2 areas of her body. This product didn't work at all and she yelped constantly when I used it. It was supposed to have 2 sides with different teeth but both sides looked identical and essentially the item just pulled out the hair causing dog to cry Definitely would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kate V

customer_reviews.title: The hair does fly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I just used it on Glory although it wasn't easy cuz she hates to be groomed but it was like taking off a second coat of dog of hair. I could probably go another hour grooming her with it but it's difficult with one person. It did take out most of the larger matts. But the smaller matts underneath her ears need a gentler touch. and the hair on the golden retriever when you're grooming it or just shedding it with something like this flies everywhere so I highly recommend doing it outside. Glory is a golden retriever 15-month-old dog.
customer_reviews.author: B. PRESS

customer_reviews.title: Grooming Tool for LONG-HAIRED Cats
customer_reviews.text: I was a victim of advertising. I have a 4-year-old tortoise-shell cat with normal, average housecat hair. She recently started to shed, so I bought this tool. This tool is intended for Big cats with VERY LONG, unmanageable, clumping hair. It most resembles a McCormick reaper. The claws on this rake are SHARP, and if you use it on a regular cat, it has to be done most delicately. Ironically, after I made my purchase, a pop-up ad announced, "Customers who bought this item also bought this:" And there was the simple, everyday cat comb I wanted all along, for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: William McCauley

customer_reviews.title: A Definite Winner, Cat Approved!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my long hair cat Max. I was using a small "Bamboo Brand" underfur comb, but he really hated it because the teeth are too close together and hurt when their were snaggles. This brush/rake gives you the option of two different widths and although he's still not nuts about grooming, it does the job and acceptable to him. I just have to use it gently. Max is 17 lbs and a beautiful gray nebalung mix, so I've got a lot of territory to cover!!! I would recommend!! Ginger/Chicago
customer_reviews.author: Mollyd847

customer_reviews.title: Best grooming tool for my cat! And he loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has very long hair. This is so much better at both getting loose fur and cleaning than any brush or comb I have ever tried. The strong teeth move right through his thick coat, grabbing all kinds of loose fur. And forget trying to get all the loose fur off any brush I used before. Cleaning this is a snap. Best part might be how much my cat loves it when I comb him! He hated being brushed for some reason, so I didn't expect his happy reaction to this. He just loves it. I think he would let me do it all day if I wanted, lol. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Greenblatt

customer_reviews.title: I love it, dog hates it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is great pyrenees mixed with something with curly fur. He loves to run in the sticker bushes. He hates this thing, but it works so well! He doesn't look as neglected as before; he even had stickers in his beard. I am still working on him, but the brush got rid of a ton of tangled fur in a hurry. If your dog is mostly a mess, give this a try. It does pull, and he protests that, but in the end, I have a much cleaner looking dog. Starting from a mess that looked like he rolled in burrs, I consider it a victory to be able to pet him without being scratched!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I returned this. I tried to be very gentle with it, but it was too harsh on my dogs. I have four with various hair lengths, and it didn't work well for any of them. I was only refunded approximately 2/3 of the purchase price, which seems unfair since I repackaged it carefully as I had gotten it and returned in within a few days of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for fine cat hair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bc I read in the reviews that it worked great for cats with long fine hair but I was terribly disappointed. It did absolutely nothing for their hair. I actually bought a shedding brush on here (brand is Pet Neat) before I bought this one and i wanted to give a different brush a try. Well I'm sticking to the pet neat brush I have bc it gets through their hair and actually gets a lot of hair out of their coat. So needless to say that this brush sadly..... sucks! A lot of money to spend for pretty much just a keychain!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scotti

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect with the brush, but I Love it! I have 3 tabbys, a medium hair Calico alico, silver point Siamese and a beautiful long haired cat as well as a German short hair pointer. I use the 9point side on the long hair cat and the other side for the other cats and the dog. It has worked wonders on all. My dog loves being brushed and I am loving the shiny coats vs the dull clumps they were getting. Quality of the brush is great and you can't beat the great price.
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great!
customer_reviews.text: Oh man this thing was well worth the money. We have an Old English Sheepdog that requires lots of grooming when kept long. I just started letting her hair get long and she started getting mats and the groomer said they would charge for a full groom if they had to get out a lot of Mats so I figured I would give this a try to save some money. This comb took out the mats so easily and or dog didn’t mind it at all. This probably saved me $50 for our next grooming visit. It has already paid for itself! I highly recommend this comb.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love this brush!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! This brush is going to change our lives! We have a border collie who sheds like crazy. This brush pulls out SO much of the undercoat. I showed it to a neighbor, who also has a dog that sheds and she bought one on the spot. I also have a dog boarding business and used it on some of the dogs. Works great on labs and golden retrievers. Basically any dog with med- long fur. You do need to he a little careful, because it will get caught up in the longer fur. I HIGHLY recommend this brush to anyone who has a shedding dog!
customer_reviews.author: jana lee corn

customer_reviews.title: Works great for huskies.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using a Furminator for our husky his whole 7 years of life. It always worked okay but I was never completely satisfied with the results. I didnt think it got deep enough and it always seemed to hurt him using it. But hey I was supposedly using the best brush, right? Wrong. This brush does a way better job at cleaning out undercoat. It was obvious how much superior it was the second we used it on our husky. He usually hates being groomed, but he stuck around for this. You can see the brush getting in there and getting that blown-out undercoat out. He looks like a completely different dog. Our husky thanks you!
customer_reviews.author: CaseyP

customer_reviews.title: My cats like being burshed now
customer_reviews.text: My cats hated being brushed, and I have scars to prove it. I've tried almost every brush out there, including the well-advertised ones that show the animals sitting next to their removed hair pile clones all happy as can be. Lies. Lies, I tell you. I found this brush on sale for Prime day, and I took the chance. I'm here to say that it's worth it full price and then some. Grooming is no longer a harrowing experience and they WANT to be brushed. I'm so happy I found this, as it took the stress out of the process for all of us.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Best comb for thick haired cats!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried everything to keep my cat's hair from clumping and knotting. When I saw this comb and read how one side starts with 9 tines, then turn it over for 16 tines, I thought this may be it. It is! My cat has extremely thick hair and I'm constantly having to cut the clumps down as far as possible. The first time I used this comb, much hair came out. Then I turned it over and suddenly the clumps were gone. She doesn't mind me grooming her now and her coat is beautiful once again. I highly recommend this comb.
customer_reviews.author: Brahms1545

customer_reviews.title: My cat this excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: My 18-year Ragdoll has had a problem grooming himself. From every time he wakes or goes to sleep when younger, he grooms once must less. He has been getting matted, and I’ve tried a few brushes, I’ve cut out some knots, and generally made both of us miserable. The first time I tried to brush him with this tool, I was able to get rid a large number of knotted areas with barely a whimper from the cat. It was easy to take the fur from the brush stopping the groomer session. Absolutely the best tool I’ve used on my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Urban

customer_reviews.title: its ok, dont think its super sharp
customer_reviews.text: Our standard poodle just got a short hair cut, and this thing definitely has some drag thru it. The dog is not matted since it was just cut and dematted. I feel with the hair being so short right now this would fly through it. It does not. I have some doubts about how sharp the blades are. I put a post it note in there to test the blade and it did not slice it like a razor would. It cut it but it was a little jagged looking. I also see several pits and imperfections on the blades.. It seems to pull before it cuts.
customer_reviews.author: DAMAN21

customer_reviews.title: but I have a pomchi with a super thick undercoat and a cat who also has an ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a LOT of pets. Most do well with a regular brush, but I have a pomchi with a super thick undercoat and a cat who also has an amazingly thick undercoat, like a husky! this doesn't do great with super long thick hair on my pomchi, but it works great on everyone else! It gets out so much hair and the cats all like it. Works especially well on a fine/long haired kitty, all the short haired kitties (and pulls some hairs I can't seem to get from the regular brush), and on my thick coated short haired kitty. Def recommend this brush and wish I had it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: nej

customer_reviews.title: Better than You'll Imagine, but one for your friend, your mom, your pastor, your bookee.
customer_reviews.text: Better than You'll Imagine, buy one for your friend, your mom, your pastor, your bookee. Instant results. Thorough deshedding of overgrown undercoat. Still needed to cut out worst hidden mats in cat undercoat, but my cat sucks at grooming herself. It's her own fault ... Had identical cat with no matting issues, so girl is dumb. Gets dog's haunches and ruff at neck on large german shepherd, like a professional priced tool. The Best (practical) purchase I've madeon Amazon in a year. Don't doubt it, just do it.
customer_reviews.author: Glorious

customer_reviews.title: Gets out even the toughest mats!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic! We have a Maine Coon cat that gets really bad tangles and mats. They almost never can be brushed or combed out and we resort to using scissors, which can be dangerous. I was skeptical about this tool being able to do anything with them, but boy was I surprised! It takes out the mats easily and does a great job on thinning the undercoat as well. Just follow the directions and start on the side with fewer teeth to get the major snarls out and then switch to the other side. Gato is a very happy cat!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Truman

customer_reviews.title: IT’S JUST OK!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this grooming tool would be much better for the price! Having found another similar tool at a fraction of the price, I cannot recommend this one for long haired cats. It just didn’t work effectively and the cats weren’t particularly fond of it either. Just wish I had looked further prior to this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mschloe

customer_reviews.title: Wild tuxedo cat hates me...
customer_reviews.text: This comb is amazing! Minii, is our most wild cat, she hates to be held, brushed, pet.... You get the idea, don't touch me is what I should have named her. After a few minutes and a small battle, she settled down and enjoyed the combing. Got one side done and I've gotten a huge pile of hair off of her already. I've also ran it over the other cats coats and was surprised how much fur came off. Right now 3 cats are trying to get in my lap for more hair removal. Very well made, this thing is amazing! Think my gal pal needs one for her dogs. Thank you for the great product! Cheers
customer_reviews.author: Lady A

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This grooming brush is great! We have a cat who came from a cat hoarder home. He is a very long haired cat and he does not always let us brush him and he hardly grooms himself. He started to get small mats all over in his fur. A regular brush wasn't doing the trick and he was starting to get very upset with us due to the pain. This brush allowed us to go over each mat a couple of times and they came out! We use this on both cats now and it gets out all of the loose hair so I don't have to deal with it on my furniture.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kuczynski

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Long-Haired & Double Coated Cats and Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! A must have for long-haired, double coated pets! I have a Maine Coon cat whose long fur develops large mats. He's a 'lazy groomer', according to my vet. This means I have todeshed & get out almost any mat he might develop. This tool works PERFECTLY on both sides. The wider teeth humanely breaks up mats and the deshedding side gets below the top coat. I also have a Pug & a Parson's terrier mix; both shed constantly. They also love this grooming tool. It works equally well on dogs and cats. And I'm less frustrated the grooming bc I feel, finally, there's a tool that actually grooms for all kinds of fur on all kinds of pets.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: OMGOSH
customer_reviews.text: Listen...I hardly ever write a review, however, this thing is AMAZING. I have a Maine Coon and a Norwegian Forrest cat and I have 2 Grand-babies I care for in my home 3 days a week. (no,I do not use this comb on my babies) Anyway, I vacuum every single day to TRY to keep up with pet hair so my Grand-babies can have a clean environment to play in. This little beauty has saved my life. I was very skeptical because of the time, money and energy wasted trying to find a solution for my cat fur problem. Pretty sure this is the last thing I'll have to purchase. Thank you, thank you!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Loriann

customer_reviews.title: = This rake will remove 50 lbs of undercoat from a 40 lb dog =
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this tool to remove more of my collies undercoat than the Furminator but within a few strokes, I had enough excess fur to create a second collie...then a third...then a fourth, etc. I was well on my way to sculpting a whole pack of fur-dogs but then the wind blew all the fur away and there was so much, the sky was darkened. It resembled a Biblical plague, only of fur, not locusts, and the pharoah texted me "Please stop grooming your dog, and I will let your people go". But lo and behold, I could not, for my collies fur had become light and luxurious.
customer_reviews.author: Carl the Viking

customer_reviews.title: Only works if you don't mind inflicting pain
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my long-haired cat. He has cancer and chemo and feels too uncomfortable to groom himself properly. This tool might work if you used it on a cat with no tangles, but then why would you need it? My cat has some tight mats, and all this does is pull at them. In order for the tool to cut through the mats, you have to pull really hard. It's quite painful for the cat - who is already uncomfortable - and I'm just not going to do it. I've gone back to scissors and a comb. It takes longer, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: A. Goebel

customer_reviews.title: Not for thick coarse hair.
customer_reviews.text: While this tool may work for some or even most dogs, but it does not work on our Siberian Husky/Australian sheep dog mix, which is what we wanted it for. The brush gets easily tangled. HOWEVER, it works on our Blue Heeler who has a very short coat. As an insignificant aside- ours did not come with the paw fob.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Does nothing, don’t waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this after seeing all the great reviews and was so exited to use it on my 2 year old lab because she needed some of that coat done with this summer and the quarantine from COVID anything helps. It was a major fail this did absolutely NOTHING. I could have done better with my bare hands. Returning ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: A nice tool for my very furry Maine Coon kitty.
customer_reviews.text: Nice! I have a very furry Maine Coon cat that gets knots. We have electric tools to remove the knits, but I hoped to get a tool to keep down the undercoat. Boudreaux likes that it isn’t noisy. He get brushed every morning. It doesn’t seem to remove the current knots, but once we keep the undercoat down maybe he won’t get as many. I’ll update you after I’ve used it awhile. So far - so good. Update: the knots are coming out and so is the undercoat. Be gentle with this thing or your precious pet will revolt.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had long-haired dogs all my life. How did I ever survive without this?!! I now have a German Shepherd/Norwegian Elkhound mix with an extremely dense undercoat. I could never get ahead of it with a regular rake and comb and then I saw this. It’s amazing how much fur comes out. No matter how much I would brush him he’d still look like I hadn’t brushed him at all. He’s got such a gorgeous coat now and I know he feels better too. Thank you for an awesome product!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Zwart

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the way this product performed on my Aussie's coat. When I started using it, fur flew everywhere. While I thought that it was designed to remove the undercoat, instead it ripped the shiny coat and left patches of what appeared to be fuzz for hair. And it did not prevent shedding. I won't be using on his coat again.
customer_reviews.author: debedo65

customer_reviews.title: doesnt really work
customer_reviews.text: I have a very large cat with varying lengths of long hair. this product looks like it should work, but all it does is pull on the hair mat and make my cat mad. seems like the blades are not sharp enough. it gets into/under the mat ok, just doesn't cut it at all. just pulls on it. it does comb out smaller, loose mats and debris. just wish i could find a product that helps cut out larger, tighter mats or at least loosen them up so my cat can get them out. back to my husband keeping him calm while i use sizzors.... looks horrible all chopped up.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs BoomBoomPapa

customer_reviews.title: A must-have during shedding season
customer_reviews.text: I have a long-haired and very fluffy cat who has often needed a haircut during shedding season, because no matter how often I brush him mats invariably form on his armpits and belly. This little tool has saved us many trips to the groomers, it cuts right through mats without cutting the cat, and from there they brush out easily. The feline in question doesn't seem to notice any difference between this and the usual brush, he's purring and doing happy paws and soaking up the attention.
customer_reviews.author: OrdinaryWorld

customer_reviews.title: This comb is AMAZING!! I tried it on my dog
customer_reviews.text: This comb is AMAZING!! I tried it on my dog...medium lenth coat...removed all the loose undercoat hair. Then tried it on my long-haired cat and I could have knitted a sweater with the fur I combed out. Finally tried it on my short-haired cat and again the amount of hair I was able to comb out of his fur was amazing....removed all his winter hair. Now, I don't typically groom my animals on a regular basis so this was a removal of hair that had been accumating for awhile but it really did an excellent job. I would highly, highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: adamsrancho

customer_reviews.title: Gently and safely works !!
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I purchased this product a few years ago ! It’s very safe to use and gently helps to breakup matted areas on my male Siberian cats coat . He is very particular about the grooming tools I use on him . Spring shedding season has arrived and as usual fur matting is our biggest issue . This tool is as gentle as the user wants and effective. I think I’m going to purchase the smaller one also to use on his neck area and upper chest . Both my Siberian cats have heavy winter coats that start shedding in February and I need to keep daily brushing and dematting !!
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This does a good job of getting out the undercoat of one of our cats who sheds like crazy, although she is not crazy about the feel of the comb. I alternate strokes with the brush she likes and she’ll tolerate that for a little bit. Our other cat gets bad mats but generally dislikes being combed even more. However he will tolerate this on his back for a few strokes, and that’s keeping the back mats under control. Eventually maybe we can get to his underside but I’m not holding out a lot of hope. It can be challenging to clean off all the hair from the teeth but doable.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieBJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: It has two types of blades, the web is sharp not the end of the curve. I was skeptical buying it because it looked all sharps. One side has blades places wide and another side a bit close. But the curves are sharp at the web, but not the end. Handle is nice to hold and my dog loved it. When I use this brush the hair is coming out like never ending.
customer_reviews.author: Pacemaker

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I tried everything to resolve the shedding problem with my white german shepherd. I got the gloves l shampoo, and multiple brushes to deshed my dog. Nothing worked. After trying many products I tried to accept that this was going to be my life, dog fur in my kitchen, car, clothes, and food. Until one day, her fur got into my wine! So I looked at Amazon for a solution. I came across this tool and was attracted to the reviews, still skeptical, I bought it. I'm glad I did! This is a lifesaver. Thank you for such an awesome product. Now I can enjoy my drink and food without worrying about ingesting fur!
customer_reviews.author: Grief Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Works great just be gentle.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Himalayan Cat and the poor thing gets knots. I found he is fine with this if I go slow and use the side that has less teeth. I just used it this morning; I do not use this every day, what a pile of hair I got. I really like this; it is the first comb that really does get his undercoat.
customer_reviews.author: Ferret Fan

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Aussie with fur like a wild ape. Double coated so can’t shave. I think I removed 5 more dogs with this undercoat rake lol. Works great but do not overuse on double coated doggos as it also pulls from the root and continues to remove hair. Once a week really, outside (oh yea, do yourself a favor and do it outdoors) makes a difference in the “tumbleweeds” we live with haha. Go gently if you have a pup that gets knots or dreadlocks as it will really pull. Well worth it. Now if I could just get him to like baths...
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful tool
customer_reviews.text: This is very helpful to get rid of the winter fur on my australian cattle dog. I would say, use with caution, or common sense. Otherwise you could really hurt your pet. If you don’t feel confident using it, follow your instincts. I used it very carefully, for like three days, until all that fue was gone. My dog is very pleasing, I don’t think she enjoyed it a bit, but I think she was happy with the end results, and I was too. Very helpful, just please be careful and go slow.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget to purchase yours great product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tool for my American Sheppard which has White long thick hair. Daily brushing and trips to the groomers for the deshedding shampooing at $140 a pop was just not working. After my first time using the amount of fur removed was unbelievable. After 2 weeks of use I am very please that Kado now not only looks great but also has very,very little hair that falls out. It use to be a daily ritual with my vacuum several times a day as the masses of dog fur throughout the house was unbelievable. Thank you for developing this product and I would highly recommend to anyone with a dog that has long hair or sheds a lot. GREAT PRODUCT.💥💥💥💥💥👍
customer_reviews.author: Dawn White

customer_reviews.title: Great for elderly animals...
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly cat who has a difficult time grooming herself. Although we brush frequently, previously if we went a few days without brushing, she would end up with tangles and mats. With this tool, it gets all of the extra fur out and keeps her from matting even when we have to go a few days without brushing. This tool did an amazing job and was gentle. She actually seems to enjoy being brushed now and we don't struggle with matting. Plus it is comfortable for me to use. Definitely a 5 star purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Faith M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I have two long haired Maine Coon cats, who were having a problem with matting. I tried everything...detangling spray, different combs and brushes, and they also see a groomer once a month. In between grooming, this tool works great! The cats don't mind it at all, and one of them purrs when I use it. one side removes the mats and tangles, and the other side helps with shedding. I was surprised at how well this worked, as my cats won't let me near them with a furminator. Excellent tool and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Malatesta

customer_reviews.title: Size is large for smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this 3 stars because I'm sure on the right size pet it can be an amazing tool. I have a Havaton and her hair is very soft, but it tends to curl and get matted the longer she is. She is also only 10lbs and very petite. So this tool was extremely large and bulky. I had a difficult time holding it to attend to her fur without hurting her. It did help with some mats, as the tool is designed nice for that. But I couldn't really get to them easily due to the size of the tool in comparison to her. I attached photos to show the tool size in comparison to my small dog.
customer_reviews.author: nward

customer_reviews.title: Best fur remover yet! Bye bye Furminator!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I am now an X Furminator user. I figure that the furminator must have hurt my guy because he hated it and it was a chore. Using this..? First the amount of fur it removes is incredible. My guy is still not too keen on me doing his hind end... it went by sooo much smoother! I highly recommend. I have a mutt that’s lab and I think coon dog. I swear he has 7 layers of fur because it’s just soooo much. This really got fur that I didn’t know was there! I’m thrilled!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Best brush ever for long haired cats
customer_reviews.text: This brush is a miracle. I have a very long haired cat and she gets a very thick winter coat. I’ve tried so many brushes and she kept getting mats and no matter how much I brushed her I wasn’t able to get all the loose fur. Ten minutes with this brush and I pulled an entire bag of fur out. She’s so much softer and slimmer looking. I got the mats out and she didn’t seem to mind it too much. It’s so easy to use and it works so well!!!! Much less shedding now, for $20 this is probably the best grooming tool I’ve found.
customer_reviews.author: Ren Stogner

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST TOOL EVER
customer_reviews.text: i have a 13 year old cat until she was 2 she had been a regular short hair cat . it had been easy no shedding or hair problems i like how she looked i did not want to get her shaved in one of those ugly lion cuts i found a groomer who would groom her to look like a short haired cat . $$ i get this done about 2 times a year or when i can't keep up with the tangles this tool is the best i have ever used to remove mats with out hurting the cat i have a drawer full of tools i will be throwing out THIS TOOL IS A WINNER
customer_reviews.author: red camry

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of cats, (6 adults + 3 kittens), and I brush each cat every single day. At the end of the daily grooming, I walk away with a grapefuit sized ball of cat fur that would have otherwise been all over our rugs/couches/stairs/chairs/bed/blankets, etc. This tool when used daily makes a noticeable difference to the amount of fur I have to vacuum up every week. I love it. Cats purr happily while getting their "brushins", so it's pretty clear they love it, too!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Pet Grooming Tool
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy enough...but no instructions besides on the box. Doesn’t show pics on how to use. Will have to see if a video exists. Tried it, got stuck, pulled my dogs skin out, not the matte. Thankfully she is not hurt...bc I didn’t force it out of her fur. Doesn’t seem to get close enough to her skin to get under the mattes. I mean she has not been groomed in three months. Maltese/Shih tzu, four yo. I didn’t rate, stretch and easy to hold, bc I didn’t know how to hold the item.
customer_reviews.author: V C Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Best tool ever!
customer_reviews.text: We have used many grooming tools on our 4 year old furboy. None of them have satisfied. A friend recommended this rake and I am SO glad I tried it. Finally - a tool we are happy to use. My boy sat calmly and even rolled over on his own to allow me to get his belly and underleg areas. He enjoyed it - no painful bristles, no discomfort. Even after everyday brushing/combing with his other tools, I was able to pull a pile out with this rake. This will definitely help with the shedding mess on our hardwood floors. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MommyofThree

customer_reviews.title: Highly efficient animal hair brush
customer_reviews.text: This 2 sided pet grooming tool is easy to hold and easy to use. I used the wide edge side on my chocolate lab and the brush got some much more hair than a regular dog brush. We have not tried the closer together side yet, but I think it will be good during the time of year when they shed their winter coat. Also have a long haired cat and she tolerated the wide side of the brush for about 3 minutes but I got a lot of the shed off her as well. I would recommend this brush.
customer_reviews.author: keisha ward

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well to remove lose hair and mats in our two dogs - a assie X and a Pyreneese - both with different coat types. It seems to flow through the coat nicely, without raking the dog's skin. The dogs sat well for grooming for fair, with is much more attention than they usually get. The tool is nice because it has two teeth widths - a wider size for initial grooming, and smaller teeth for final grooming. It is easy to hold and use, and we are very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: m.j.

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY...a great grooming tool.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several different grooming tools for my long haired cats (and have ended up returning them b/c they don't work). This is the first one that I have tried that will easily remove mats and undercoat and most importantly, that they will tolerate. It removes a lot of fur along with tangles in a way that does not hurt the animal. It has two sides, one with wider combs to start with and then the other side with closer combs to finish, if needed. Thank you for designing a tool that works this well and won't break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job but be Gentle
customer_reviews.text: This brush does work to get tangles out of my Persian cat's hair. I like that there are two size options. If you want to prevent tangles it is best to do this everyday. My cat is so sensitive so I am trying to brush him as much as possible to get used to it. Fingers crossed. Rake does work well though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect brush for retrievers
customer_reviews.text: Great product! We have a black retriever with long hair who sheds like crazy! I seriously have to vacuum daily. I'd been looking for something to help him ditch his undercoat and possibly lessen the amount of black fur floating around the house. This brush is great. We had just taken him to the groomers a couple days ago and it still picked up a ton of fur. I can't imagine how much it would've gotten if he hasn't just been groomed. I wish i had piled it all up and taken a photo but you can tell in the pic that it's everywhere! Definitely filled my vacuum up lol
customer_reviews.author: Emily Sion

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly does this thing work well! I don’t use it daily, but when my long haired corgi starts to shed, we knock it out in a single, short session with this rake. I can’t believe how well it works! He doesn’t seem to be bothered at all if it touches the skin, unlike other sharp grooming tools. I do recommend combing through first, so it’s not cutting through knots and tangles that don’t need to be. Awesome product. Didn’t need the little tag, but it’s cute I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Dooby Doo

customer_reviews.title: The best de-shedding tool I've used!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after a recommendation from a friend and have since recommended it to another friend because it is absolutely the best tool I have used on my labs! It is comfortable for them and really gets the undercoat out and leaves their coats smooth and healthy looking. It is like it massages while you are brushing them. I have another popular tool for de-shedding but it is not as comfortable and the teeth are sharper. I love it and so do my dogs!
customer_reviews.author: choclabmom

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted/needed
customer_reviews.text: Einstein is a long haired orange wild man .... with a temper to match. He thinks he actually rules the house.... and sometimes I think so too. When his hair started getting gnarly .. I tried brushing him out ... a box of band aids later I found you folks and decided to get this brushing tool instead of buying more band aids. He was twitchy at first ... but patience and a bit of help from my husband ... Voila! Einstein is happy ... the house is peaceful ... THANK YOU!! Would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Shoe's Mom

product_meta.title: Pet Grooming Tool - 2 Sided Undercoat Rake for Cats & Dogs - Safe Dematting Comb for Easy Mats & Tangles Removing - No More Nasty Shedding and Flying Hair
product_meta.description:
Searching for the perfect Dematting Tool for your furry friend, but do not feel like spending time choosing the best variant?
You don't have to, we have done it for you! 

 Try our Pat Your Pet Dematting Rake and get rid of all that nasty mats, tangles and knots. Get healthy, shiny and well-groomed hair of your furry friend! 

 Mats don’t only make the coat look disheveled, but also irritate the skin and become a breeding ground for parasites. The pet starts scratching causing the mat to grow in size and the hair to get even more tangled. 

 But don’t panic! Pat Your Pet will help you to solve all your pet hairy issues with New Dual-Sided Dematting Comb! 

 BENEFITS & FEATURES 

 * You’ll get 2-in-1 grooming tool - Dual-sided comb has 9 teeth side for tough mats and tangles and 17 teeth side for thinning and de-shedding.
 * Perfect for large and small breed animals with medium and long coat.
 * Stop pulling the hair out - Slightly sharpened blades smoothly cut through the toughest mats.
 * Reduce shedding Regular brushing removes excess dead hair from your pet's undercoat.
 * 100% Safe for your furry friend - Rounded teeth ends do not scratch or irritate the skin.
 * Recommended by professional groomers for faster and more impressive grooming results.



 As an extra bonus from Pet Your Pet you will get very cute paw tag for your cat or dog! Just attach it to your pet collar with your contact info engraved on the backside, and never worry about your beloved pet being lost. 

 So, what are you waiting for? As you see, we have thought everything out, our dematting tool is just what you need! 

 Press "ADD TO CART" now and when you do, consider getting two... one for you and one as a gift for a friend! 

 Have only the best moments with your furry friend and enjoy your clean house!
feature_bullets: 2-in-1 dual head - Start with 9 teeth side for stubborn mats and tangles and finish with 17 teeth side for thinning and deshedding. Achieve faster and more professional dematting and grooming results
Absolutely safe to your pet - No-scratch rounded outside teeth gently massage the pet skin. Meanwhile, teeth inner side is sharp enough to smoothly cut through the toughest mats, tangles and knots

Forget about shedding - Regular brushing easily removes dead undercoat so no fur goes flying. Skin massage ensures better blood circulation promoting healthy and shiny coat. Perfect for medium and long haired pets
Enjoy comfortable brushing - Soft ergonomic anti-slip grip makes regular combing convenient & relaxed. No-rust stainless steel teeth are ultra durable & easy to clean
Make your grooming routine easy - With this brush you'll keep your pet attractive and home hair-free

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
